skill.name: coder
skill.description: Write, edit, and refactor code with full tool access - Use when you need to actually write or modify code, create files, run commands, or implement features.
skill.summary: Write, edit, and refactor code with full tool access - Use when you need to actually write or modify...
skill.author: 0xSero

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only YAML metadata and AI instructions. No executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or command execution capabilities. All 18 static findings were algorithmic false positives triggered on benign metadata field names and documentation text.

content.value_statement: Need to write new features, fix bugs, or refactor existing code. This skill provides a focused AI subagent that follows project conventions and makes precise code modifications with minimal targeted edits.
actual_capabilities: Write new code files and functions from specifications
Edit existing code with minimal targeted changes
Follow project code style and conventions
Verify changes with tests or checks
limitations: Requires clear specifications to produce accurate results
May need guidance on project-specific patterns
Output quality depends on prompt clarity
Cannot access external APIs or services directly

use_cases.title: Feature implementation
use_cases.description: Implement new features from specifications while following existing code patterns

use_cases.title: Refactoring assistance
use_cases.description: Refactor code sections to improve readability and maintainability

use_cases.title: Bug fix automation
use_cases.description: Apply targeted fixes to resolve specific bugs or issues in the codebase

prompt_templates.title: Simple feature request
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a function that [describe functionality]. Follow the existing code style in the project.

prompt_templates.title: Code modification
prompt_templates.prompt: Modify the [specific function/file] to [describe the change needed]. Keep the overall structure intact.

prompt_templates.title: Refactoring task
prompt_templates.prompt: Refactor [specific section] to improve readability. Maintain the same behavior and public API.

prompt_templates.title: Implementation with tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement [feature description] including the implementation and corresponding tests. Verify the solution works correctly.

output_examples.input: Add a function to calculate the average of a list of numbers
output: Handles empty list by returning None

output_examples.input: Refactor the user authentication module to use async/await
output: Converted all callback-based auth functions to async
Updated function signatures to return awaitable results
Added error handling for async operations
Maintained backward compatibility with existing API

output_examples.input: Fix the memory leak in the data processing pipeline
output: Identified unreleased connections in database pool
Added proper cleanup in finally blocks
Replaced streaming approach with chunked processing
Verified fix with memory profiling tools

best_practices: Provide clear, specific requirements for best results
Mention existing code patterns to follow
Specify any edge cases to handle
Ask for verification steps when accuracy matters
anti_patterns: Vague requests like fix the code without specifics
Expecting the AI to guess project architecture
Skipping test verification for critical changes
Making large sweeping changes in one request

faq.question: Which AI models support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code platforms.

faq.question: What types of code can this skill handle?
faq.answer: Any programming language. Provide context about your projects coding conventions.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with my workflow?
faq.answer: Call the skill when you need to write, edit, or refactor code. Provide clear specifications.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill operates locally and does not store or transmit your code externally.

faq.question: Why are my results not accurate?
faq.answer: Ensure your prompt is specific. Include file paths, expected behavior, and edge cases.

faq.question: How does this compare to coding directly?
faq.answer: This skill provides an AI assistant for implementation. Complex architectural decisions still benefit from human review.
